Animal species would need to adapt to a new environment and potentially develop new behaviors to survive.
The increased size of animals could lead to changes in their metabolism and energy requirements.
The larger animals would have a greater impact on their ecosystems, potentially disrupting food chains and habitats.
Larger animals could have an advantage in hunting or defense, but could also be more vulnerable to predation.
The increased size of animals could lead to new opportunities for research and conservation efforts, as well as potential benefits for humans such as increased meat production.
